summary: "The Stranger," written by Albert Camus in 1942, is a short novel about a man named Meursault who lives in Algeria. After his mother dies, Meursault kills an Arab man without much reason. The story is told in two parts, before and after the murder. Though it was written during World War II, the book wasn't very popular at first. Later, it became famous for its unique take on life's meaninglessness, known as absurdism. Many people consider it a classic, and it has been made into movies and inspired other books and songs.
title: The Stranger (Camus novel)
